Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and black in section, interior slightly grooved and light-brown in colour, the exterior bears faint traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.207)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36352) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36352)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 362 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13398 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
